title: Suspect in Stabbings at Museum of Modern Art Apprehended in Philadelphia
sub_head: Police say arrest, charges are pending extradition to New York
body:
A man being sought in connection to a stabbing of two employees at New York City’s Museum of Modern Art was apprehended in Philadelphia early Tuesday morning, the New York Police Department said.
The man, identified as 60-year-old Gary Cabana, on Saturday afternoon jumped over a reception desk and stabbed two of the museum’s employees who denied him entry because of a revoked membership.
